result.execSummary:
The defendant Riley E Leistiko was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court grants sentence credit of two days in lieu of payment of $50.00 fine and $200.00 court costs.  Deemed paid in full.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Riley E Leistiko

defendant.name: Leistiko, Riley E
defendant.address: W303s3550 Saint Davids Dr, Waukesha, WI 53189

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Kees advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

2:43 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary Caitlin Brejcha in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Riley E Leistiko in court.  SPD Intern Erik Schlueter, for attorney Anna M Kees in court for Riley E Leistiko. 

The Court conducts a plea colloquy with the Defendant.
The Defendant pleads guilty to Count 3.
The Court finds the Defendant guilty of Count 3.
Counts 1 & 2 is dismissed and read into Count 3.

The State gives its sentencing recommendation.
The Defense gives its sentencing recommendation.
The Defendant presents a statement.


**COUNT 3**

Court orders the following:

FINE $50.00.
DNA Surcharge $200.00.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
The Court grants 2 days credit and waives the costs for total fine/surcharge: $250.00.

Payment of Fine/Forfeiture/Costs/Surcharges: Defendant to pay $50.00 /month commencing September 15, 2022 and each month thereafter.  Civil judgment to be entered as penalty for non payment. 


Expunction is conditionally granted after 6 months has pass, upon payment of all costs and fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on August 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

01:06 PM Defendant Riley E Leistiko in court, in custody, with State Public Defender Law Intern.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
